intro.title: Who I am
intro.briefDesc: I am a passionate self-taught web developer and lifelong learner looking to use my skill set to make a positive impact in this world. I am always looking to broaden my knowledge not just to keep up with market trends, but to learn how I can make a difference today. Feel free to shoot me a message if you have any questions or inquiries!

featProj.title: Featured Project
featProj.desc: My friend from college and professional basketball player Jestin Lewis wanted a website to advertise his summer camp and to sell his merchandise. Click the button below to view the case study!

bio.p1: Thank you for visiting my portfolio page!
bio.p2: I started my journey of learning web development in the summer of 2017, when I was talking with my cousin about possible career paths. He suggested that I take a look at web and software development, as he is currently working a full time developer. Not only that, it didn't necessarily matter that I received a Computer Science degree or not. Instead, I could take the time to learn and apply my skills as well as demonstrate that I know how to effectively do the job in order to get hired. After much thought and research, I made the decision to make this my career path.
bio.p3: After a few lessons on Free Code Camp and Treehouse, I started making my own projects and attending local meetups to learn from experienced developers. Along the way, I ran into multiple obstacles in my learning, but my new support network encouraged me to keep pushing forward. With each line of code I wrote, I gained more and more confidence in my work and knowledge of web development and created several static sites. Soon, my friends told me it was time to apply to jobs!
bio.p4: Finally, after applying for 70 jobs across the country, I finally got a job as a full time developer in Maryland! I am very thankful for all of the hard work I put in as well as the encouragement I received from my friends along this journey. The best part is I have come to realize that I have become a lifelong learner, gaining knowledge of new technologies and utilizing them in my new projects. In addition, I hope to inspire others to achieve their goals of becoming a developer as well since I attribute much of my success to the people who mentored me while I was learning code.

community.p1: I am proud to be a community leader in
community.p2: , a non-profit organization founded by my cousin with the goal of making a tech career possible for its members.
community.p3: We host educational meetups and have a network of mentors who are committed to assisting new developers in learning code and finding a rewarding job in the tech industry.
community.p4: All of our meetups and events are located throughout the southeast United States. However, due to our recent growth, we are looking to expand our influence throughout the country, helping more people achieve their goals along the way!

blog.p1: I am also a new blogger on the site Medium! I am thankful to have published my first article through Code Connector and look forward to the articles to come.
blog.p2: Click on the link to read my first article! I hope that you will be inspired!

intro.title: Jestin Lewis
intro.p: In my attempt to make a single page application using plain HTML, CSS/Sass, and Javascript, I created a page for a good friend from college. His name is Jestin Lewis and is currently a professional basketball player in Germany. We aimed to promote Jestin's name and brand through his summer camp and merchandise sales.

p1.p: These were our goals for the site:
p1.li1: Design and develop a simple landing page
p1.li2: Advertise Jestin's annual basketball summer camp
p1.li3: Allow people to sign up for the camp through the site

p2.one: To start, I installed Gulp in the project files to automate and expedite my tasks. The tasks I ran not only compiled Sass to a minified CSS on save, but also reloaded the browser to preview my changes.
p2.two: As mentioned before, I used Sass instead of plain CSS. Not only was I able to write faster code, but I was also able to define important features. In addition, Gulp minified the CSS output to reduce on file size and improving site performance.

p3.one: Since I adhere to mobile first design, not only did I initialize my Sass code for mobile devices, but I regularly viewed the site on a mobile device to ensure responsiveness.
p3.two: In addition, I used Bootstrap's navigation bar and grid features that makes it easy to develop for multiple screen sizes. For example, when a user accesses the site on a mobile device, the navigation bar becomes a dropdown menu instead of spanning the header.
p3.three: I also implemented a feature in the Javascript that loads a landscape photo on mobile and a portrait photo for desktop on the introduction section.

p4.one: To advertise the summer camp, I included a promo image that he had been sharing on his Facebook page. I also included his contact information on the page. To allow people to sign up for the camp, I implemented a Google Form that Jestin to collect responses on a trusted platform that uses Recaptcha to prevent spam. In addition, Google provided me the HTML code to embed the form in the page!
p4.two: Jestin also wanted me to have a photo gallery of last year's camp. I used jQuery to show and hide the gallery at the click of a button.
p4.three: After adding in the gallery, I added the shop section. Although we have not officially launched the shop, we are looking to start an account through Shopify, which allows customers to purchase Jestin's products online in a secure manner.

p5.one: In conclusion, I am very pleased with how this project turned out! Jestin is also very satisfied and has been sharing his new site's link on social media. I am happy with this project because I was able to use newer skills to take my web development passion to another level!
p5.two: BRO I LOVE IT!!!! Man Thank You so much!!!!
